title: Confidence Intervals
description: Confidence intervals are a range of values used to estimate the true value of a population parameter. They provide an interval within which we can be certain, to a specified level of confidence (usually 95%), that the true parameter lies. The width of the interval depends on the sample size and variability in the data.

memoryTricks.content: Confidence intervals give us a range, like a safety net, to catch the true value.
Confidence Interval Song: 'Estimate with confidence, find the range, it's common sense!'
